Saunder, a solar finance company providing debt capital to solar enterprises in emerging markets, today announced its first disbursement in Nigeria, part of a facility of up to $4m with commercial and industrial (C&I) solar developer, Daystar Power.
Esperanza, in partnership with MoveUp, has announced the deployment of EdApp to transform the way their not-for-profit organisation workforce engages in business training and social support.

Bang said there were no obvious means for the Libra Association to become profitable or make money from its users. "When you don’t understand how money gets made, it gets made in ways you don’t like," he said.

Malia Aroma attended industrialist Arvind Dubash\'s 50th birthday bash in Jailer, which was a starry affair indeed.
Kolkata\'s first cabaret dancer Miss Shefali died on Thursday. She was undergoing treatment for kidney-related ailments.
Kalki Koechlin welcomes her daughter into the universe today with a beautiful post on Instagram. She named her after Sappho, the Greek poet.
Mary Higgins Clark, the tireless and long-reigning "Queen of Suspense", died on January 31.

While the AAP\'s thumping victory in Delhi polls is being projected as validation of its development model, several state governments have already taken a cue from the Arvind Kejriwal dispensation\'s flagship Mahala clinic scheme and are replicating it.
The BJP failed to make much impact in constituencies where its leaders made controversial remarks while targeting their opponents during campaigning for the Delhi Assembly polls.
The new Delhi Legislative Assembly will have 16 first-time MLAs, all from the Aam Aadmi Party, including Atishi, Raghav Chadha and Dilip Pandey.

Virat Kohli\'s captaincy has come under the scanner after a 3–0 ODI series whitewash vs New Zealand as the Indian skipper also went through a rare bad rubber with the bat accumulating just 75 runs in the 3 matches.
For the first time in 23 years, India were whitewashed in an ODI series with 3 or more matches. This is only the 4th such instance in India\'s ODI cricket history.
